verses.verse: What <WG5101> shall we say <WG2046> then <WG3767>? Shall we continue <WG1961> in sin <WG266>, that <WG2443> grace <WG5485> may abound <WG4121>?
God forbid <WG1096>. How <WG4459> shall we <WG2198>, that <WG3748> are dead <WG599> to sin <WG266>, live <WG2198> any longer <WG2089> in it <WG846>?
Know you not <WG50>, that <WG3754> so many of us as <WG3745> were baptized <WG907> into <WG1519> Jesus <WG2424> Christ <WG5547> were baptized <WG907> into <WG1519> his <WG846> death <WG2288>?

Therefore <WG3767> we are buried with <WG4916> him <WG846> by <WG1223> baptism <WG908> into <WG1519> death <WG2288>: that <WG2443> just as <WG5618> Christ <WG5547> was raised up <WG1453> from <WG1537> the dead <WG3498> by <WG1223> the glory <WG1391> of the Father <WG3962>, even so <WG3779> we <WG2249> also <WG2532> should walk <WG4043> in <WG1722> newness <WG2538> of life <WG2222>.

For <WG1063> if <WG1487> we have been <WG1096> planted together <WG4854> in the likeness <WG3667> of his <WG846> death <WG2288>, we shall be <WG2071> <WG99999> also <WG2532> in the likeness of his resurrection <WG386>:

Knowing <WG1097> this <WG5124>, that <WG3754> our <WG2257> old <WG3820> man <WG444> is crucified with <WG4957> him <WG2443>, that the body <WG4983> of sin <WG266> might be destroyed <WG2673>, that <WG3588> henceforth <WG3371> we <WG2248> should <WG1398> not <WG3371> serve <WG1398> sin <WG266>.
For <WG1063> he that is dead <WG599> is freed <WG1344> from <WG575> sin <WG266>.
Now <WG1161> if <WG1487> we are dead <WG599> with <WG4862> Christ <WG5547>, we believe <WG4100> that <WG3754> we shall <WG4800> also <WG2532> live with <WG4800> him <WG846>:

Knowing <WG1492> that <WG3754> Christ <WG5547> being raised <WG1453> from <WG1537> the dead <WG3498> dies <WG599> no more <WG3765>; death <WG2288> has <WG2961> no more <WG3765> dominion <WG2961> over him <WG846>.
For <WG1063> in that <WG3739> he died <WG599>, he died <WG599> unto sin <WG266> once <WG2178>: but <WG1161> in that <WG3739> he lives <WG2198>, he lives <WG2198> unto God <WG2316>.

Likewise <WG3779> consider <WG3049> <WG99999> also <WG2532> yourselves <WG1438> to be <WG1511> dead <WG3498> indeed <WG3303> unto sin <WG266>, but <WG1161> alive <WG2198> unto God <WG2316> through <WG1722> Jesus <WG2424> Christ <WG5547> our <WG2257> Lord <WG2962>.

Let <WG936> not <WG3361> sin <WG266> therefore <WG3767> reign <WG936> in <WG1722> your <WG5216> mortal <WG2349> body <WG4983>, that you should <WG1519> obey <WG5219> it <WG846> in <WG1722> the lusts <WG1939> there <WG846>.

Neither <WG3366> yield <WG3936> your <WG5216> members <WG3196> as instruments <WG3696> of unrighteousness <WG93> unto sin <WG266>: but <WG235> yield <WG3936> yourselves <WG1438> unto God <WG2316>, as <WG5613> those that are alive <WG2198> from <WG1537> the dead <WG3498>, and <WG2532> your <WG5216> members <WG3196> as instruments <WG3696> of righteousness <WG1343> unto God <WG2316>.

For <WG1063> sin <WG266> shall <WG2961> not <WG3756> have dominion over <WG2961> you <WG5216>: for <WG1063> you are <WG2075> not <WG3756> under <WG5259> the law <WG3551>, but <WG235> under <WG5259> grace <WG5485>.

What <WG5101> then <WG3767>? Shall we sin <WG264>, because <WG3754> we are <WG2070> not <WG3756> under <WG5259> the law <WG3551>, but <WG235> under <WG5259> grace <WG5485>? God <WG3361> forbid <WG1096>.

Don <WG3756>'t you know <WG1492> that <WG3754> to whom <WG3739> you yield <WG3936> yourselves <WG1438> servants <WG1401> to <WG1519> obey <WG5218>, his servants <WG1401> you are <WG2075>? <WG3739> <WG99999> Whether <WG2273> of sin <WG266> unto <WG1519> death <WG2288>, or <WG2228> of obedience <WG5218> unto <WG1519> righteousness <WG1343>?

But <WG1161> God <WG2316> be thanked <WG5485>, that <WG3754> you were <WG2258> the servants <WG1401> of sin <WG266>, but <WG1161> you have obeyed <WG5219> from <WG1537> the heart <WG2588> <WG99999> that form <WG5179> of teaching <WG1322> which <WG3739> was delivered you <WG3860>.
Being <WG1659> then <WG1161> made free <WG1659> from <WG575> sin <WG266>, you became the servants <WG1402> of righteousness <WG1343>.

I speak <WG3004> after the manner of men <WG442> because of <WG1223> the infirmity <WG769> of your <WG5216> flesh <WG4561>: for <WG1063> as <WG5618> you have yielded <WG3936> your <WG5216> members <WG3196> servants <WG1401> to uncleanness <WG167> and <WG2532> to iniquity <WG458> upon <WG1519> iniquity <WG458>; even so <WG3779> now <WG3568> yield <WG3936> your <WG5216> members <WG3196> servants <WG1401> to righteousness <WG1343> unto <WG1519> holiness <WG38>.
For <WG1063> when <WG3753> you were <WG2258> the servants <WG1401> of sin <WG266>, you were <WG2258> free <WG1658> from righteousness <WG1343>.

What <WG5101> fruit <WG2590> had you <WG2192> then <WG5119> in <WG1909> those things of which <WG3739> you are <WG1870> now <WG3568> ashamed <WG1870>? For <WG1063> the end <WG5056> of those things <WG1565> is death <WG2288>.

But <WG1161> now <WG3570> being made free <WG1659> from <WG575> sin <WG266>, and <WG1161> become servants <WG1402> to God <WG2316>, you have <WG2192> your <WG5216> fruit <WG2590> unto <WG1519> holiness <WG38>, and <WG1161> the end <WG5056> everlasting <WG166> life <WG2222>.

For <WG1063> the wages <WG3800> of sin <WG266> is death <WG2288>; but <WG1161> the gift <WG5486> of God <WG2316> is eternal <WG166> life <WG2222> through <WG1722> Jesus <WG2424> Christ <WG5547> our <WG2257> Lord <WG2962>.
